title: RC circuit - compare power dissipated by resistors

content.description: The circuit shown consists of an ideal battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> <math alttext="epsilon" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>∆ê</mi></math>, three resistors with the resistances indicated, a capacitor of capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>C</mi></math>, and a switch. The capacitor is initially uncharged and the switch is initially open.
content.question: When the switch is open, which of the following correctly compares the powers <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> dissipated by the resistors with resistances <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 1 equals P sub 2, which equals P sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub 3 is greater than open parenthesis, P sub 1 equals P sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub 1 equals P sub 2, close parenthesis is greater than P sub 3, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub 1 equals P sub 2, close parenthesis is greater than open parenthesis, P sub 3 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub 3 is greater than open parenthesis, P sub 1 equals P sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
